meanings.sent1: They debase the product by using cheap materials.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to debase someone's hard work.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to debase the value of the coin by turning it into a button.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt like using that color would debase the entire painting.
meanings.sent5: The chef knew that adding too much salt would debase the flavor of the dish.

meanings.sent1: He would never debase himself by lying to others.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to debase others with hurtful words.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes sometimes debase the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The gossip magazine's articles often debase the reputations of celebrities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded the students not to debase their classmates with mean comments.

meanings.sent1: The debased soldier was assigned to menial tasks.
meanings.sent2: She felt debased after being demoted at work.
meanings.sent3: The debased chair in the waiting room was always empty.
meanings.sent4: The debased team struggled to win any games this season.
meanings.sent5: The debased employee had to report to a new supervisor.
